Peserta Wisata Horor Tuntut Panitia Kembalikan Uang Pendaftaran
03 Nov 2019, 11:16 by Imam Hamdi, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Peserta Jakarta Mystical Tour menuntut penyelenggaraan paket wisata horor di ibu kota mengembalikan uang mereka. Penyelenggara tur ke lokasi yang dianggap angker di Jakarta itu adalah Biang Overlender.
"Saya minta uang pendaftaran wisata dikembalikan. Saya kecewa setelah nyaris celaka setelah mengikuti paket wisata itu," kata Manta, peserta Jakarta Mystical Tour saat dihubungi, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
Adapun uang pendaftaran mengikuti paket wisata itu sebesar Rp 350 ribu. Penyelenggara mengajak 47 peserta mengunjungi sejumlah lokasi yang dianggap angker seperti Museum Taman Prasasti, Toko Merah, Museum Sejarah Jakarta, Jembatan Ancol, perlintasan kereta Tragedi Bintaro, TPU Jeruk Purut, Taman Langsat, Menara Saidah, dan Terowongan Casablanca.
Manta menuturkan peserta tur wisata ke lokasi yang dianggap angker itu nyaris celaka tersambar kereta rel listrik di perlintasan terjadinya Tragedi Bintaro 1987 pada pukul 23.40, Jumat, 1 November 2019. Peserta nyaris ditabrak KRL saat ingin foto bersama di perlintasan KRL dari arah Tanah Abang menuju Bintaro.
Menurut Manta, penyelenggara tidak merencanakan dengan matang tur tersebut. Sebabn, panitia tidak mengetahui bahwa masih ada perjalanan kereta saat peserta mendatangi perlintasan kereta tersebut. "Kami bisa menyelamatkan diri karena lari dan loncat setelah melihat lampu sorot kereta," ujarnya. "Saya sampai terperosok ke solokan dan luka-luka tanpa diobati"..
Ananda Satria, pihak operasional Jakarta Mystical Tour, menyatakan tidak melanjutkan kegiatan tur mistis tersebut. "Walau animo masyarakat masih besar, kami berencana cukup mengadakan dua kali saja," kata Ananda Satria, pihak operasional Jakarta Mystical Tour, kepada Tempo, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Jakarta Mystical Tour rencananya diadakan dalam tiga gelombang. Gelombang pertama telah berlangsung pada 18 Oktober 2019 dan gelombang kedua pada 1 November 2019. Adapun gelombang ketiga akan diadakan pada 15 November 2019.
Ananda mengatakan, belajar dari wisata horor pada Jumat, 1 November 2019, panitia menyadari ada beberapa agenda yang keluar dari rencana dan membahayakan peserta. Salah satu peristiwa yang hampir membuat kecelakaan adalah saat rombongan mengunjungi lintasan rel kereta tempat Tragedi Bintaro 1987 terjadi.
Saat itu rombongan diajak berkumpul di rel kereta sekitar pukul 23.50. Panitia luput memastikan jadwal kereta yang melintas, sehingga rombongan tur panik ketika mengetahui KRL masih beroperasi. Peserta rombongan wisata horor berlari tak tentu arah menghindari sambaran kereta listrik yang melaju.
Beberapa di antara mereka mengalami luka-luka karena terjatuh saat menghindari kereta. Ada pula yang tercebur ke selokan yang berada di samping rel. Peserta yang mengalami luka terkilir dibawa ke rumah sakit. Ada juga kerusakan handphone milik peserta saat panik menghindari kereta.
Ananda mengatakan sudah memantau jadwal KRL, namun acara tak sesuai perencanaan. "Permintaan akan meminta maaf secara terbuka," kata dia.

Horror Tourism Participants Demand the Committee to Return the Registration Fee
03 Nov 2019, 11:16 by Imam Hamdi, Ninis Chairunnisa
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Jakarta Mystical Tour participants demand the holding of horror tour packages in the capital to return their money. The organizer of the tour to the location that was considered haunted in Jakarta was Biang Overlender.
"I asked for the tour registration money to be returned. I was disappointed after almost being hurt after joining the tour package," said Manta, a Jakarta Mystical Tour participant when contacted on Sunday, November 3, 2019.
The registration fee for the tour package is IDR 350 thousand. The organizer invited 47 participants to visit a number of locations considered haunted such as the Taman Prasasti Museum, the Red Shop, the Jakarta History Museum, Ancol Bridge, the Bintaro Tragedy crossing, the Jeruk Purut TPU, the Langsat Park, the Saidah Tower, and the Casablanca Tunnel.
Manta said that the participants of the tour to the location that was considered haunted almost struck by an electric train at the crossing of the 1987 Bintaro Tragedy at 23.40, Friday, November 1, 2019. Participants were almost hit by KRL when they wanted to take a photo together at the KRL crossing from Tanah Abang towards Bintaro .
According to Manta, the organizer did not carefully plan the tour. Because, the committee did not know that there was still a train trip when participants came to the railroad crossing. "We could save ourselves from running and jumping after seeing the train's spotlights," he said. "I fell into a ditokan and injured without being treated" ..
Ananda Satria, the operational of the Jakarta Mystical Tour, said that it did not continue the mystical tour. "Although public interest is still large, we plan to hold it twice," Ananda Satria, the Jakarta Mystical Tour operational, told Tempo on Saturday, November 2, 2019.
The Jakarta Mystical Tour is planned to be held in three waves. The first wave has taken place on 18 October 2019 and the second wave on 1 November 2019. The third wave will be held on 15 November 2019.
Ananda said, learning from the horror tour on Friday, November 1, 2019, the committee realized there were some agendas that went out of plan and endangered participants. One of the events that almost caused an accident was when the group visited the railroad tracks where the 1987 Bintaro Tragedy occurred.
At that time the group was invited to gather on the railroad tracks around 23.50. The escape committee confirmed the passing train schedule, so the tour group panicked when they learned that the KRL was still operating. The participants of the horror tour group ran indeterminate direction avoiding the striking electric train that drove.
Some of them suffered injuries due to falling while avoiding the train. There is also a splash into the gutter beside the rails. Participants who suffered sprained injuries were taken to the hospital. There was also damage to the participant's cellphone while frantically avoiding the train.
Ananda said that he had monitored the KRL schedule, but the event was not according to plan. "Requests will apologize publicly," he said.
